metadata.title: CVE-2019-19058 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak in the alloc_sgtable() function indrivers/net/wireless/intel/iwlwifi/fw/dbg.c in the Linux kernel through5.3.11 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption)by triggering alloc_page() failures, aka CID-b4b814fec1a5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19058` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1074-azure - 4.15.0-1074.79~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1074.79~14.04.1').
